Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, such as one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include different kinds of plants in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include different kinds of animals or living things in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants in land habitats, and fish or clams in water habitats.
The student can show different types of living things that exist in different habitats by drawing them.
The student can use drawings to compare the variety of plants and animals found in the two different habitats.
The student can observe patterns of diversity by showing how some kinds of living things are found in both habitats and some are specific to each habitat.
